sections.summary: Successful believers are identified by their **humility in prayer**, avoidance of nonsense, and work for **charity**. They are free from blame when they safeguard their **chastity** from all but their spouses or dependents. These faithful individuals are the inheritors of **Paradise**, where they will dwell forever.

Allah originates **man** from an extract of clay, developing him through stages including a seed, a clot, a lump, and bones clothed with flesh. This biological process serves as evidence of the **Best of Creators**. Following these stages, humanity faces **death** and is destined to be **resurrected** on the Day of Judgment.

The creation of **seven pathways** above and the provision of **rainwater** in precise measure demonstrate Allah's regulation of the universe. This water produces gardens of palms and vines for human consumption and nurtures trees that provide oil and seasoning. Lessons are further found in **livestock**, which provide drink from their bellies and serve as a means of **transportation**.

Noah is commissioned to invite his people to **monotheism**, but the disbelieving elite label him as a possessed man seeking superiority. By divine order, Noah constructs the **Ark** to preserve his family and pairs of every species while the **wrongdoers** are drowned. The landing is described as **blessed**, signifying the success of those who rely on Allah.

Allah establishes subsequent generations and sends messengers, yet the dignitaries reject the concept of **life after death** as legends. They mock the messengers for being mortals who eat and drink like themselves, dismissing the promise of **resurrection** as farfetched. Ultimately, these rebellious communities are struck by a **Blast** and turned into scum as a consequence of their wicked conduct.

Messengers were sent in succession, though each community initially called their messenger a liar. **Moses and Aaron** were granted clear authority and signs to confront Pharaoh, who turned away in **arrogance**. Additionally, the son of Mary and his mother are established as a miraculous **sign**, sheltered by Allah on secure high ground.

Messengers are exhorted to consume good things and act with **integrity**, reminding humanity that their nation is a **single community**. Despite this, humanity splintered into **sects**, with each faction distracted by their own opinions. The provision of material **wealth and children** is framed as a trial rather than an immediate rush of goodness.

Those who race toward goodness are characterized by their **awe of their Lord** and their belief in His **Verses**. They avoid **shirk** and give with hearts that quake at the realization of their eventual **return to Allah**. These individuals are the first to reach the reward of their righteous deeds.

Allah does not burden any soul beyond its **capacity** and maintains a truthful **Record** of all deeds. Disbelievers remain distracted and reject the Message, even though they recognize the truthfulness of the Messenger. It is affirmed that even if Allah removed their **affliction**, they would blindly persist in their **transgression**.

Allah is the producer of human **hearing, sight, and feelings**, yet humanity shows little **gratitude**. Skeptics continue to doubt the **resurrection**, while the text refutes the claim that Allah has begotten a son. Multiple gods are declared impossible, as they would have sought **supremacy** over one another, leading to universal chaos.

Believers are commanded to repel evil with what is better and to seek refuge from the suggestions of **devils**. Upon death, the wicked unsuccessfully plead for a return to earth to correct their neglect. They are instead held behind a **barrier (Barzakh)** until the Day they are raised for judgment.

When the Horn is sounded, worldly relations are severed and deeds are evaluated on the **Scales**. Those with light scales are the losers who will dwell in **Hell** and acknowledge that their own wretchedness prevailed over them. In contrast, the patient are rewarded with **triumph** for their endurance.

Human life on earth will seem to have lasted only a day or part of a day during the final **reckoning**. The text clarifies that humanity was not created in **vain** and that the **True King** is far above having partners. The surah concludes with a call to seek **forgiveness and mercy** from the Lord.
